sp_instance.title: Get Your Own Copy!
sp_instance.widget_parameters:
{ "html": { "value": "

Any application that offers one or more links to the application source can be installed on your ServiceNow instance. It only takes a few simple steps for each applcation - create a copy of the app, install the app from GitHub, create demo data (optional).

Prerequisites

  • ServiceNow instance - If you don't already have one, you can get a free developer instance at the ServiceNow Developer Portal.
  • GitHub account - Sign in or sign up for a free account at GitHub.

Instructions

I. Create a copy of the application in GitHub.

  1. Login to GitHub.
  2. From the City of Lightspeed application page, click the link provided for the application's source code. This brings you to the GitHub page for that application.
  3. Click the Fork button in the upper right.
  4. GitHub creates a copy of the application under your account.
  5. When complete, click the "Clone or Download" button, then click the clipboard icon to copy the URL to the clipboard.

II. Install on ServiceNow

  1. Login to your ServiceNow instance with admin credentials.
  2. Navigate to System Applications> Studio.
  3. Choose Import from Source Control.
  4. Paste the GitHub URL you copied earlier in the URL field.
  5. Provide your GitHub login and password in the corresponding fields.
  6. Click Import.
  7. Start exploring in Studio!

 

Repeat these steps for each repository if the application is made up of multiple links on the City of Lightspeed application page.

III. Create Demo Data (optional)

  1. Navigate to System Definition> Scheduled Jobs.
  2. Locate and open the record with the name "RUN ME FIRST - xxxx", where 'xxxx' is the name of the application (e.g. RUN ME FIRST - City Guide Demo Events')
  3. Click the button "Execute Now"
  4. The scheduled job runs in the background and may take a minute or two to run.
